holidays.name: National Read a Book Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to unplugging from digital distractions and diving into the magical world of books.
holidays.origin: Established by book lovers and educators to encourage reading for pleasure and learning.
holidays.funFact: Studies have shown that reading regularly can reduce stress levels by up to 68%!

holidays.name: Fight Procrastination Day
holidays.description: Encouraging people to stop putting things off and get those tasks done right now!
holidays.origin: Created by productivity experts to motivate people to overcome the universal struggle with procrastination.
holidays.funFact: Procrastination affects about 20% of adults consistently, but today is the perfect excuse to start fresh.

holidays.name: National Coffee Ice Cream Day
holidays.description: Celebrating the deliciously cool and energizing treat that combines two great loves: coffee and ice cream.
holidays.origin: Originated in the USA to honor coffee-flavored ice cream as a unique summer indulgence.
holidays.funFact: Coffee ice cream was first made by Italian immigrants in America who blended their love of espresso with gelato techniques.

holidays.name: Read a Dirty Book Day
holidays.description: A cheeky, fun day to embrace some naughty literature and dare to spice up your reading list!
holidays.origin: Unofficial holiday that encourages readers to explore romance and erotic genres without guilt.
holidays.funFact: Erotic literature is one of the best-selling genres worldwide, often outperforming more 'serious' books.
